content: Huh, the Themes page on b...org doesn't show themes but modules for me! What do others see there? https://backdropcms.org/themes
Oops, right, that's all modules! Someone messed the view view-id-modules view-display-id-themes, probably a filter should be "overridden" but isn't (anymore). Who can fix this?

Who can fix this?

Maybe @jenlampton or @klonos ?

I've fixed it on the live site, but I believe that it will need proper in-code config export and push to https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org ... @jenlampton or @BWPanda (Peter) can help with that.

backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Issue tracker for the BackdropCMS.org website. Contribute to backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.
...I've checked the layouts view display, and that one was OK.

While at it, should I delete the https://backdropcms.org/project/elevation node? ...I'm reluctant, since https://backdropcms.org/project/usage/elevation shows more than a dozen sites using it :thinking:
...when trying to install this theme via the Project Browser, you get an error that the .zip file cannot be downloaded.
Thanks @klonos for fixing the Themes page! Regarding the Elevation theme, ask @Robert Garrigos?
Thanks @Olaf Grabienski and @klonos for finding and fixing the themes page!

I noticed yesterday that the exposed search was missing, so "fixed it" but apparently did more harm than good! I've committed the config on live and sync;d down to stage, so we should be all set now with the change @klonos made.
Thanks @jenlampton :+1:
I made the Elevation theme but got to delete the files as there were license rectrictions I missunderstood. It can be deleted.
